dismissalText.commentary: Hashmatullah Shahidi c †Liton Das b Rubel Hossain 58 (92b 3x4 0x6) SR: 63.04

dismissalComment.html: edged and taken. Hangs back at the crease and opens the face to run it down to third man. But the bowler has given him minimal room here, and that results in an outside edge that settles into the hands of the keeper Liton

headshotImage.caption: Rashid Khan player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Rashid Khan player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalText.commentary: Rashid Khan not out 57 (32b 8x4 1x6) SR: 178.12

headshotImage.caption: Shakib Al Hasan headshot
headshotImage.longCaption: Shakib Al Hasan headshot

headshotImage.caption: Mohammad Shahzad player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Mohammad Shahzad player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalComment.html: and now he holes out to long-on, spectacular catch from debutant Abu Hider! Shahzad was showing his intent after the drinks break and now he charged down to loft that ball down the ground but could not get enough to send it all the way. Abu Hider was at long-on, he covered a fair distance to his left but was a few yards inside the boundary so he jumped at the last moment and held on to it with both hands. Since he was inside, he had enough ground behind him to tumble and then celebrate with his arms stretched, like Shahid Afridi

headshotImage.caption: Asghar Afghan headshot
headshotImage.longCaption: Asghar Afghan headshot

dismissalComment.html: comes down the track and he's missed it completely! It was flighted generously just outside off on good length, Asghar was tempted and he came down, drove the wrong line and the ball went in as a natural variation to knock the top of off and middle stumps

headshotImage.caption: Samiullah Shinwari headshot
headshotImage.longCaption: Samiullah Shinwari headshot

dismissalComment.html: goes for the big shot and he misses it completely! Shenwari was eating up too many deliveries against the spinners. He wants to release the pressure by trying to loft this length ball on off to the leg side but misses the line and the ball goes with the angle to knock over middle

headshotImage.caption: Mohammad Nabi headshot
headshotImage.longCaption: Mohammad Nabi headshot

dismissalComment.html: plumb. Shakib's problematic angles making life hard for the Afghan batsmen. He was giving no room and sliding them around middle which is dead accurate and makes it hard to swing big. So Nabi decides to sweep but the angle is too sharp and he misses as the ball hits the back leg

headshotImage.caption: Abu Hider player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Afif Hossain player page headshot cutout, 2021

headshotImage.caption: Ihsanullah Janat player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Ihsanullah Janat player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalComment.html: straight to cover. Wicket in the first over of his debut match for Hider. And it's not a delivery he would've imagined would've fetched him his maiden wicket. Short, ample width, flayed straight and hard into the hands of Mohammad Mithun

headshotImage.caption: Rahmat Shah player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Rahmat Shah player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalComment.html: off-stump pegged back. Creates a beautiful angle after drawing the batsman forward with a length ball. Angles it into his off-stump and the ball comes on with the arm to go past the inside edge as the batsman leaves daylight between bat and body

dismissalText.commentary: Shakib Al Hasan lbw b Rashid Khan 32 (55b 0x4 0x6) SR: 58.18

dismissalComment.html: loud, loud appeal, this one beats Shakib completely for pace and Rod Tucker raises the finger. Bangladesh don't have a review left and they shouldn't have used it anyway. Flat and quick on middle and leg, Shakib goes back and is a bit too late to bring his bat down, the ball skids off to hit on the pad right in front of the middle stump and the keeper and Rashid scream in celebration

dismissalText.commentary: Mahmudullah b Rashid Khan 27 (54b 2x4 0x6) SR: 50

dismissalComment.html: here's the wrong'un, here's another wicket for Rashid! Mahmudullah might have picked the googly there because he kept the bat in front of the stumps even though the ball pitched outside off. But it didn't turn as much as he expected and the ball came in just a bit to rattle the off stump. Rashid and Shahzad bring out the dab

dismissalText.commentary: Litton Das lbw b Aftab Alam 6 (14b 0x4 0x6) SR: 42.85

dismissalComment.html: sharp inswing again, loud appeal and he's been given! Liton is a bit unsure and he's gone for the review after consulting Shakib. Length delivery outside off, comes in, hits the front pad right in front of off and middle and looks like the second noise was of bat hitting the pad, not the inside edge. Ball-trcking says it's hitting and Liton walks off. The batsman would have reviewed straightaway had it been an inside edge, this was plumb and Bangladesh's only review is gone in the fifth over

dismissalText.commentary: Mominul Haque c †Mohammad Shahzad b Gulbadin Naib 9 (17b 0x4 0x6) SR: 52.94

dismissalComment.html: strays down leg, Shahzad goes up again for a catch as he collects it. They have reviewed. Was there a little feather as he tried to whip it away off the pads? There well may have been. Confirmed by Ultra Edge. Great review; off goes Mominul. Bangladesh three down

dismissalText.commentary: Abu Hider run out (Rashid Khan) 1 (11b 0x4 0x6) SR: 9.09

dismissalComment.html: what can't Rashid do today? A direct hit this time and there's the aeroplane celebration. Mosaddek made plenty of room to drive inside out but didn't middle it and the ball deflected off Rashid towards mid off. It made Abu Hider go for the run but he was sent back and by then Rashid had sprinted towards mid-off, picked the ball and turned around in no time and even hit the stumps to send the bails flying

commentPostTextItems.html: Rashid Khan: I'm really happy with my performance and the best thing was I performed with both bat and ball. My main focus was to bat till the end and I think our preparation was good to play till the end. Our fielding was amazing and the conditions were really hard and tough. We've been working hard on our fielding, we focus a lot on that. I've been coming on to bowl late because I want to build pressure by bowling more dot balls and the batsmen give their wickets. You can't rely on or two kind of players on these kind of pitches. I want to dedicate this award to our ex board chairman Atif Mashal who has done a wonderful job for us in the last few years.

Asghar: It was a very important game for us and I'll give a lot of credit to Naib and Rashid for their effort. Our top and middle order didn't play very well but thanks to god Naib and Rashid did very well. Yes, it will be tough for other teams to chase 230 kind of totals against us because of our bowling and fielding. I do have a groin issue but I'll let the physio decide tomorrow on my status for the match (against Pakistan)

10.55pm Chasing these totals of over 200 (barring Hong Kong's attempt against India) is proving to be real tough in this tournament. It could be the heat, it could be the slow pitches that don't have much for the batsmen or bowlers, or it could just be a rewind to the '90s when 250 used to be match-winning. That's all from us tonight, Akshay and I, Vishal, need some sleep too. You can join us tomorrow for the next stage, here are the matches....Until then, it's goodbye and good luck!
SHRAVAN: "Afghanistan play India in super four not Pakistan??" India v Bangladesh and Afghanistan v Pakistan
Surbhi Oberoi: "These are some big victories for AFG, happy to see them grow. Rashid Khan is a superstar in making(if not already). Well played!"

Virag: "As good as it is to see Rashid Khan play his weight in Gold , it is great to see other players like Naib and Shahidi come to the party. Cricket is a team game after all and you need team efforts to take you far."
Rohit: "What a way to enter his 20s! - Happy Birthday Rashid Khan!!"

10.36pm What a comprehensive performance from Afghanistan, they are unbeaten in the Asia Cup after facing Sri Lanka and Bangladesh. At one point it looked like Shakib was taking the match away from them with his stifling lines and four wickets in the first innings. But Bangladesh put the foot off the pedal when Afghanistan were seven down, only to see birthday boy Rashid Khan snatch the game from them. A scintillating half-century in the company of Gulbadin Naib, two wickets after the opening bowlers did the damage and then a run-out too. He aptly leads his team off the field after this massive win.

Mashrafe Mortaza: Afghanistan outplayed us from the 40th over. They played really well and we didn't bowl well in the last 10 overs and batting wasn't up to the mark. We have a big match tomorrow and boys need to be fresh. It's a bit difficult to recover from back to back matches in this heat. Mushfiqur and Mustafiz were rested today because of the niggles.
Jigar Aiya: "Afghanistan is no more underdog. Now very much in race for trophy"
Harsha: "Asia Cup is turning into a huge success with Afganistan and Hong Kong being 2 new forces to reckon with."

dismissalText.commentary: Abu Hider run out (Rashid Khan) 1 (11b 0x4 0x6) SR: 9.09

commentTextItems.html: what can't Rashid do today? A direct hit this time and there's the aeroplane celebration. Mosaddek made plenty of room to drive inside out but didn't middle it and the ball deflected off Rashid towards mid off. It made Abu Hider go for the run but he was sent back and by then Rashid had sprinted towards mid-off, picked the ball and turned around in no time and even hit the stumps to send the bails flying
he reads the googly and blocks it front of the stumps
he connects this time and finds backward point with the cut
Shahzad appeals as Mosaddek goes back to cut the legbrak and misses
straightish on the stumps, he stays back and defends
just outside off stump this time, he punches it back

tries a slog across the line and gets a single on the leg side
gets a full toss this time towards the pads and goes for the big shot this time, smashing it between deep midwicket and long on for four

dismissalText.commentary: Mohammad Shahzad c Abu Hider b Shakib Al Hasan 37 (47b 4x4 0x6) SR: 78.72

dismissalComment.html: and now he holes out to long-on, spectacular catch from debutant Abu Hider! Shahzad was showing his intent after the drinks break and now he charged down to loft that ball down the ground but could not get enough to send it all the way. Abu Hider was at long-on, he covered a fair distance to his left but was a few yards inside the boundary so he jumped at the last moment and held on to it with both hands. Since he was inside, he had enough ground behind him to tumble and then celebrate with his arms stretched, like Shahid Afridi

dismissalText.commentary: Litton Das lbw b Aftab Alam 6 (14b 0x4 0x6) SR: 42.85

dismissalComment.html: sharp inswing again, loud appeal and he's been given! Liton is a bit unsure and he's gone for the review after consulting Shakib. Length delivery outside off, comes in, hits the front pad right in front of off and middle and looks like the second noise was of bat hitting the pad, not the inside edge. Ball-trcking says it's hitting and Liton walks off. The batsman would have reviewed straightaway had it been an inside edge, this was plumb and Bangladesh's only review is gone in the fifth over

dismissalComment.html: loud, loud appeal, this one beats Shakib completely for pace and Rod Tucker raises the finger. Bangladesh don't have a review left and they shouldn't have used it anyway. dismissalText.commentary: Abu Hider run out (Rashid Khan) 1 (11b 0x4 0x6) SR: 9.09

dismissalComment.html: what can't Rashid do today? A direct hit this time and there's the aeroplane celebration. Mosaddek made plenty of room to drive inside out but didn't middle it and the ball deflected off Rashid towards mid off. It made Abu Hider go for the run but he was sent back and by then Rashid had sprinted towards mid-off, picked the ball and turned around in no time and even hit the stumps to send the bails flying

dismissalComment.html: sharp inswing again, loud appeal and he's been given! Liton is a bit unsure and he's gone for the review after consulting Shakib. Length delivery outside off, comes in, hits the front pad right in front of off and middle and looks like the second noise was of bat hitting the pad, not the inside edge. Ball-trcking says it's hitting and Liton walks off. The batsman would have reviewed straightaway had it been an inside edge, this was plumb and Bangladesh's only review is gone in the fifth over

milestones.description: Gulbadin Naib and Rashid Khan's 95-run partnership is AFG's highest for the 8th wicket in ODIs, breaking the record of 66 between Mirwais and Rashid Khan
Shakib has scored 46 fifty-plus scores in ODIs, the most for BAN breaking Tamim Iqbal's record
This is the lowest match aggregate (374) involving teams Bangladesh & Afghanistan in ODIs
Shahzad has scored 16 fifty-plus scores in ODIs, the most for AFG breaking Rahmat Shah's record
Gulbadin Naib has broken the record for most ducks (5) in ODIs for AFG, going past Dawlat Zadran's 5
Mortaza has broken the record for playing the most ODIs (190) for BAN, going past Shakib

stories.title: Rashid Khan's birthday special destroys Bangladesh
stories.subTitle: Afghanistan v Bangladesh, Asia Cup 2018, Group B, Abu Dhabi
stories.seoTitle: Rashid Khan's birthday special destroys Bangladesh
stories.summary: On his 20th birthday, the legspinner struck a 32-ball 57 to breathe life into a stuttering Afghanistan innings, and then took two wickets and effected a run out, becoming Afghanistan's leading wicket-taker along the way

image.caption: Rashid Khan celebrates a scintillating half-century on his birthday
image.longCaption: Rashid Khan celebrates a scintillating half-century on his birthday, Afghanistan v Bangladesh, Group B, Asia Cup 2018, Abu Dhabi, September 20, 2018

stories.title: Tight schedule could force Afghanistan, Bangladesh to rest players for dead-rubber clash
stories.subTitle: Afghanistan v Bangladesh, Asia Cup 2018, Abu Dhabi
stories.seoTitle: Tight schedule could force Afghanistan, Bangladesh to rest players for dead-rubber clash
stories.summary: Bangladesh will have to travel to Dubai after the match to meet India in the Super Four on Friday, while Afghanistan will stay put in Abu Dhabi, where they will meet Pakistan

stories.title: Rashid Khan's birthday special destroys Bangladesh
stories.subTitle: Afghanistan v Bangladesh, Asia Cup 2018, Group B, Abu Dhabi
stories.seoTitle: Rashid Khan's birthday special destroys Bangladesh
stories.summary: On his 20th birthday, the legspinner struck a 32-ball 57 to breathe life into a stuttering Afghanistan innings, and then took two wickets and effected a run out, becoming Afghanistan's leading wicket-taker along the way

image.caption: Rashid Khan celebrates a scintillating half-century on his birthday
image.longCaption: Rashid Khan celebrates a scintillating half-century on his birthday, Afghanistan v Bangladesh, Group B, Asia Cup 2018, Abu Dhabi, September 20, 2018

stories.title: Tight schedule could force Afghanistan, Bangladesh to rest players for dead-rubber clash
stories.subTitle: Afghanistan v Bangladesh, Asia Cup 2018, Abu Dhabi
stories.seoTitle: Tight schedule could force Afghanistan, Bangladesh to rest players for dead-rubber clash
stories.summary: Bangladesh will have to travel to Dubai after the match to meet India in the Super Four on Friday, while Afghanistan will stay put in Abu Dhabi, where they will meet Pakistan

image.longCaption: Rashid Khan wheels away in celebration, Afghanistan v Sri Lanka, 3rd ODI, Group B, Asia Cup, September 17, 2018
